page.title: 03WITLEY PARK FARM ESTATE
page.content: The whole park consists of 1300 acres of ground.The other crops growing in the fields are barley,maize and rye. The barley is sold to merchants,the maize is turned into silage,and the rye is sold to a company which makes the 'Ryvita' biscuits,known for their low calorie content.There is also a garden area containing several greenhouses which are now being used to grow tomatoes on a commercial scale. A private shoot takes place on Wednesdays from November until the end of January.The invited guests are allowed a brace of game and the rest of the pheasant and partridge is usually sold locally. { Prince Charles}has visited Witley Park Farm to play polo with Martin Brown,son of the present owner,Sir Raymond Brown.
